channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Tech Elites in the Epstein Files
item.description: The Department of Justice has released more than 3 million documents and photos related to Jeffrey Epstein. Here’s who shows up from Big Tech the most...

item.title: Dyson Deals: WIRED’s Top Pick Pet Vacuum and Purifier-Heater
item.description: WIRED’s favorite pet vacuum and our favorite purifier-heater are on steep discount right now.

item.title: Our Favorite Soundbar for Most People Is $50 Off
item.description: Yamaha’s simple setup and substantial subwoofer set it apart, especially on sale.

item.title: Adobe Animate is shutting down as company focuses on AI
item.description: Adobe Animate will be discontinued on March 1, 2026, as Adobe shifts its focus to AI.

item.title: HHS Is Using AI Tools From Palantir to Target ‘DEI’ and ‘Gender Ideology’ in Grants
item.description: Since March of 2025, the Department of Health and Human Services has been using tools from Palantir and the startup Credal AI to weed out perceived al...

item.title: Two Stanford students launch $2M startup accelerator for students nationwide
item.description: "Breakthrough’s purpose is to fill in the funding and opportunity gap that exists in many of these ecosystems because students have historically lacke...

item.title: What Snowflake’s deal with OpenAI tells us about the enterprise AI race
item.description: Snowflake is the latest enterprise to sign multi-year deals with multiple AI companies in what could be a sign to come of a future trend.

item.title: China is leading the fight against hidden car door handles
item.description: The Chinese government issued a new rule that goes into effect January 1, 2027.

item.title: 3 Best Floodlight Security Cameras (2026), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Light up and secure your driveway, backyard, or porch with a floodlight security camera.

item.title: Firefox will soon let you block all of its generative AI features
item.description: Starting with Firefox 148 arriving later this month, users will find a new AI controls section within the desktop browser settings.
